conclusion: The skydiver's speed at t = 10 s is about 20 m/s and at t = 15 s is about 10 m/s.
Over the 5-s interval the curve descends roughly linearly.
Treating that part of the graph as a trapezoid.
Distance fallen ≈ (average speed) × (time) = 15 m/s × 5 s = 75 m.
The graph falls a little faster than a perfect straight line at first, so the true area under the curve is slightly less than that of the ideal trapezoid.
The actual distance is a bit below 75 m.
The distance fallen from 10 s to 15 s is slightly less than 75 m.
